description: From the character Shylock in Shakespeare's The Merchant of Venice (1600).

entries.meaning: (offensive, ethnic slur) A person of Jewish descent.
examples: Synonyms: (not always pejorative) Yid, heeb, Hymie, kike, sheeny

verbs.description: shylock (third-person singular simple present shylocks, present participle shylocking, simple past and past participle shylocked)

entries.meaning: (intransitive, US) To lend money at exorbitant rates of interest.
examples: I wanted to know whether shylocking is a legal business or not, and if it is legal, under which Act does it operate?
